The plant forms a symbiotic relationship between a fungus and a green alga or cyanobacterium, which allows it to thrive in various habitats. Notobubon is typically found on rocks, soil, or tree bark in temperate and arctic regions. Its slow growth and ability to survive in harsh environments make it an important indicator species for environmental conditions.
